title: Google\Cloud\Batch\V1\TaskSpec
name: TaskSpec
description:
Spec of a task

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.batch.v1.TaskSpec

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.runnables
params.description: The sequence of scripts or containers to run for this Task. Each Task using this TaskSpec executes its list of runnables in order. The Task succeeds if all of its runnables either exit with a zero status or any that exit with a non-zero status have the ignore_exit_status flag. Background runnables are killed automatically (if they have not already exited) a short time after all foreground runnables have completed. Even though this is likely to result in a non-zero exit status for the background runnable, these automatic kills are not treated as Task failures.

params.name: data.max_run_duration
params.description: Maximum duration the task should run. The task will be killed and marked as FAILED if over this limit.

params.name: data.max_retry_count
params.description: Maximum number of retries on failures. The default, 0, which means never retry. The valid value range is [0, 10].

params.name: data.lifecycle_policies
params.description: Lifecycle management schema when any task in a task group is failed. The valid size of lifecycle policies are [0, 10]. For each lifecycle policy, when the condition is met, the action in that policy will execute. If there are multiple policies that the task execution result matches, we use the action from the first matched policy. If task execution result does not meet with any of the defined lifecycle policy, we consider it as the default policy. Default policy means if the exit code is 0, exit task. If task ends with non-zero exit code, retry the task with max_retry_count.

params.name: data.environments
params.description: Environment variables to set before running the Task. You can set up to 100 environments.

params.name: data.volumes
params.description: Volumes to mount before running Tasks using this TaskSpec.

params.name: data.environment
params.description: Environment variables to set before running the Task.

Background runnables are killed automatically (if they have not already exited) a short time after all foreground runnables have completed. Even though this is likely to result in a non-zero exit status for the background runnable, these automatic kills are not treated as Task failures.
